__TOC__



This week's Hug Day will focus on '''Telepathy-Butterfly''' known as the MSN support used in Empathy. 

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your '''Launchpad Id''' in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged. 

=== Tools ===

For doing your work easier during the hug days remember to use the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/Tools|hugday-tools]]</nowiki>.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

To sign up for 5-A-Day participation, please add your Launchpad ID to the Participants column. (This is not the email address you used for signing up for LP, but the last part of the URL that https://launchpad.net/people/+me redirects you to (everything behind the ~ sign)):

1. Click on https://launchpad.net/people/+me
2. Look at the URL bar, everything behind the ~ sign is your Launchpad ID. 

Also sign up here: https://launchpad.net/~5-a-day-participants/+join

=== Stock Responses ===

For problem specific Stock Responses see: <nowiki>[[Bugs-Responses]]</nowiki>

=== Testing and Bug reporting ===

For doing the testing of the current bug reports or report a new one please install the latest packages of empathy and telepathy-butterfly on Karmic, If you're using Jaunty you can use the packages from the <nowiki>[[https://edge.launchpad.net/~telepathy/+archive/ppa|Telepathy team PPA]]</nowiki>.

=== Debugging ===

Debugging instructions can be found at:

* <nowiki>[[http://telepathy.freedesktop.org/wiki/Debugging|Telepathy Debugging Page]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://live.gnome.org/Empathy/Debugging|Empathy Debugging Page]]</nowiki>

Please do read those before doing triage on the product.

=== Forwarding Bugs Upstream ===

Telepathy uses the freedesktop BTS for tracking their bugs, if you want to file a new bug about butterfly there you need to go to <nowiki>[[https://bugs.freedesktop.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=Telepathy|this page]]</nowiki> and select the telepathy-butterfly component on the component list (right side of the screen), more general instructions on how to send bugs there can be found at the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/Upstream/Freedesktop|Howto send bug reports to Freedesktop]]</nowiki> page.
